intro: Sarcorhachis venezuelana, commonly known as the Venezuelan thornbush, is a shrub native to Venezuela and parts of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and lance-shaped leaves with a rough, hairy texture. It produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and its fruits are dry, three-lobed capsules. Sarcorhachis venezuelana is adapted to dry and disturbed habitats, often found in savannas and rocky areas.
